Teacher will need to model the question and response with a puppet. Use TPR and a lot of facial expressions. “Fine” should be a happy expression like the boy in the green shirt.

hild to copy the same and say
Model circling the sun high in the sky. Use TPR to show that the sun is up by making a circle with your hands up above your head and saying
Circle the sun lower in the sky.
Show the sun that is lower by making a circle with hands at about chest level while saying
TPR: The teacher will model saying, “Good Afternoon.” Encourage child to copy.
Model circling the sun lower in the sky. Use TPR to show that the sun is lower by making a circle with your hands at about chest level while saying
Do the action of yawning as it is nearing bedtime while saying Good
TPR: The teacher will model saying, “Good
,” while yawning because it is near bedtime. Encourage child to copy the same and say the phrase.
and the sun high in the sky action
TPR: Teacher and student do the morning stretch action to show good morning
. Then they make the action for the sun high in the sky.
Student says good morning by repeating after the teacher.
Using finger gestures in a circle, encourage child to circle the morning picture.
Do the sun lower in the sky action
TPR: The teacher and student make the sun lower with their hands to show the afternoon.
Using finger gestures in a circle, encourage child to circle the afternoon picture

Student says good evening by repeating after the teacher.
Using finger gestures in a circle, encourage child to circle the evening picture
Circle the words hello and goodbye
Model saying hello and then good-bye, encourage child to repeat
Using finger gestures in a circle, encourage child to circle the words goodbye and hello
Students will correctly draw a line from the correct greetings to their pictures.
Using finger gestures or completing one sample problem, model drawing a line from the phrase to the pictures.
How are you? I’m fine, I’m ok
Do a facial expression for each feeling.
and then circling the picture for fine, okay, and great.
Ask the child how they are and have them circle how they are feeling.
Using finger gestures, encourage child to draw a line to match up the words with the pictures for fine, okay and great
Freeform “Show and Tell” Conversation Activity Slide
Students should have a blank slide to draw a picture of
good morning, good afternoon, good evening, fine, okay, great
Read words from the lesson (hello, hi, bye, fine, okay, great)
Teacher will prompt student to draw a picture to represent
good morning, good afternoon, good evening, fine, okay, great
through pictures. One prompt at a time.
Teacher will write words from the lesson (hello, hi, bye, fine, okay, great) and student will read them.
Students will read and spell their new words:
hello, hi, goodbye, bye, fine, okay, great, good morning, good afternoon, good night
Teacher will give feedback on the spelling and pronunciation of the new words.
